function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Unclear definition of terms such as 'neighbourhood environment' and 'built environment' may lead to inconsistent inclusion or exclusion of studies related to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Inclusion of irrelevant studies may dilute the findings and conclusions of the systematic review, leading to inaccurate recommendations for disease mitigation in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Provide clear and specific definitions of terms related to the built environment in the screening and inclusion criteria for studies. Use standardized definitions to ensure consistency in study selection.","Technologies":"Standardized screening tools and database search algorithms can be used to identify relevant studies based on predefined criteria related to contagious diseases in the built environment.","People":"Reviewers, researchers, and public health professionals involved in the systematic review process.","Owner":"Review authors, research sponsors, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Inadequate piloting of data extraction sheet may result in incomplete or inaccurate recording of study details, leading to potential data errors and bias in the synthesis and analysis.","Impact":"Incomplete or inaccurate data extraction may compromise the reliability and validity of the systematic review findings, undermining the evidence-based recommendations for disease mitigation in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Thoroughly pilot the data extraction sheet on a representative sample of manuscripts to identify and address potential issues. Provide clear guidelines and training for data extraction to ensure uniform and accurate recording of study details.","Technologies":"Data extraction software with built-in validation and consistency checks can help minimize errors and discrepancies in recording study details.","People":"Authors developing the data extraction sheet, reviewers responsible for data extraction, and researchers conducting the synthesis and analysis.","Owner":"Research team, project leads, and organizations funding the systematic review."},{"Description":"Publication bias or selective reporting in meta-analysis may lead to an inaccurate estimation of the association between greenspace and contagious diseases in the built environment.","Impact":"Misleading conclusions and recommendations may result from an inaccurate estimation of the association, leading to suboptimal strategies for mitigating contagious diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analyses and explore potential sources of bias, such as unpublished studies or unpublished data, to assess the robustness of the findings. Transparently report the methods used to assess publication bias and the impact on the meta-analysis results.","Technologies":"Statistical software with tools for assessing publication bias, such as funnel plot analysis and Egger's test, can aid in identifying and addressing potential bias in meta-analysis.","People":"Statisticians, researchers conducting meta-analysis, and reviewers interpreting the meta-analysis results.","Owner":"Research team, project leads, and organizations funding the systematic review."}]}
